oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Hilary Williams - 2018-09-29
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by Hilary Williams from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on September 29, 2018. Accompanied on guitar by Max Khalesy (sic). Includes questions from the audience.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hilary Williams;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Opening comments and songwriter introduction by Julea Tomerson / (04:14) Opening comment by Hilary / (04:38) Introduces the first song / (04:57) Performs Bedside Manner / (09:03) Introduces the next song / (09:33) Performs Beautiful Things / (12:26) Introduces the next song / (12:41) Performs My Lucky Scars / (14:56) Performs Shipwreck / (19:10) Answers question about writing with other songwriters / (20:08) Answers question about her recovery from her car accident in 2006 and how it affected her career / (20:38) Performs Crazy / (24:48) Talks about the previous song / (25:06) Introduces the next song / (25:40) Performs Sign Of Life / (29:54) Introduces the next song / (30:40) Performs House Of Gold / (33:17) Responds to comment about being an inspiration to accident victims and talks about her injuries / (35:04) Answers question about when she realized the impact both her father and grandfather have made / (36:00) Tells story about being with her father in public when he was recognized and talks about her upbringing / (37:19) Answers question about not feeling pressure from her parents / (37:37) Answers question about listening to her grandfather's music / (37:48) Answers question about performing with her father and talks about his songs / (38:42) Acknowledges audience members comments / (39:30) Talks about her songwriting and if she shares her songs with other artists / (39:49) Introduces friends in the audience / (40:47) Answers question about the album My Lucky Scars / (41:17) Talks about using the voice app on her iPhone for song ideas / (41:58) Answers question about the Monday Night Football jingle and sings part of it / (42:32) Talks about losing her voice during her surgeries / (43:28) Introduces the next song / (43:51) Performs Old Habits / (46:18) Final comments / (46:36) Walk-out music / (47:12) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Williams, Hilary, 1979-; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
